summary: This document is an email chain from January 15, 2021, between an Assistant United States Attorney and an FBI Special Agent from the Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force. They are coordinating a meeting to 'check in on Maxwell' and discuss next steps, indicating ongoing case management for Ghislaine Maxwell's prosecution.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Coordinates a meeting to check in on the Maxwell case and discuss next steps with an FBI Special Agent.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.role: FBI Special Agent - Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: Participates in scheduling a meeting with a prosecutor to discuss the Maxwell case.

connections.description: Coordinating a meeting to discuss the Maxwell case, indicating they are working together on the prosecution.

events.title: Proposed Maxwell Case Check-In Meeting
events.description: A meeting is proposed for Friday, January 22, 2021, between a prosecutor and an FBI agent to 'check in on Maxwell' and discuss next steps.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
New York Office (FBI - Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force)
keyFacts: The email chain is dated January 15, 2021, showing ongoing coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case after her arrest.
The subject is 'Maxwell Check In,' indicating regular case management and strategy discussions between prosecution and law enforcement.
The participants include an Assistant U.S. Attorney and an FBI Special Agent from the Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force, highlighting the interagency nature of the investigation.
The proposed meeting date is January 22, 2021, to discuss 'next steps,' suggesting active planning for the legal proceedings against Maxwell.
The correspondence is marked as 'EXTERNAL EMAIL,' indicating communication between different government agencies (DOJ and FBI).
